title: Quick Gameplay Thoughts: May 2
body:
Morning all,

Mid-season goes out tonight/tomorrow barring any last minute unexpected problems! Really looking forward to seeing how you folks find it and how it changes our perception of what needs work in 7.10 and beyond.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**Usual Disclaimers**

These posts will often contain talk about future work we're doing, or planning to do, that isn't yet guaranteed to ship. The nature of the work could change or, depending on what we discover, projects mentioned may get put delayed or even stopped.

If you'd like to see a Tweet whenever a new one of these posts goes up: https://twitter.com/RiotMeddler


-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**More 7.10 changes**

7.10 should be hitting the PBE today, and with it some in development work. Since we've had to start development on that before mid-season was live it's more likely than usual that we may need to change direction a bit on some of this stuff. Changes include:

* Ivern: Lowered movement speed, higher health and mana cost per camp taken. Dude's just straight too strong
* Rakan: Shifting some power from his E (lower shield strength) to his Q (100 more range) and probably W (bit more damage at present). Looking to ensure his play's not too dominated by just ally shielding. Probably power neutral overall.
* Rumble: Shifting some damage from Q to Overheat auto attacks, with the goal of making his laning a bit more interactive (Overheat autos require him to draw minion agro). Also aiming for power neutral, but with better game health.


-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**PSA on Rift Herald**

One thing I'd suggest watching out for with the new Rift Herald that goes out tomorrow is that the channel to summon it is interruptible. Hadn't thought about that myself much until yesterday when during a playtest I tried summoning it just as a teamfight was starting to break out for a bit of extra pressure and someone promptly CC'd me, stopping the channel which also consumes the item. Recommend learning from my mistake on that one and either hanging back a bit when summoning or taking advantage of opponents trying to do so too far fowards.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**Mid Season Spotlight**

I'd imagine most of you have already seen it, for those that haven't a Mid Season spotlight went out yesterday though. Worth a look, and also at the end includes a brief glance (super brief) at one of the screens from the 5 ban system for ranked/draft that's being worked on right now.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7Fl2Wg5rkew
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**ARAM Followup**

7.8 contained some adjustments to ARAM. We've been analyzing how those have gone and will probably be doing a bit of further followup work, hopefully in 7.10. Details to follow.

I miss the coin Items - not because of the bonus gold. The Passive HP Regen was rly nice and the **Talisman of Ascension **was also a great Item to play with. It had nice engaging and dis engaging potential - and with it gone **Raptor Cloak **has no Item to build into anymore.

That's uh, that's a lot of added power, not just satisfaction. Given the amount of mobility Rakan's got, and his two sources of hard CC, we don't think we can afford to put more utility on his kit, especially not on a low risk ability.

If you nerf anything about Lee Sin, it should be his ultimate cooldown. Lee Sin normally has around 30% CDR in a build, and his ultimate is up all the time in the mid-game. It's very frustrating for Lee to use it to escape being caught out, and then have it about a minute later for a big fight. Needs to be punished for using it flippantly.
100% this
Nerf his ms already.

Remember last year's Worlds patch? Lee got a very interesting buff and I argued a lot with my friends that this will definitely put him back in the meta. His 2nd cast W bonus lifesteal and spell vamp got doubled for Rank 1. 

Have you guys considered reverting that buff? Lee Sin nowadays looks like he's got a lot of strength, since he's really good with single target damage and 2 out of the three single unit camps are buffs - which are very important.

I feel like he might have to much damage...usually jungler's that are so good at ganking have less damage to offset that, they have to rely on the laner. Look at Rek'Sai for a pretty good example. 

But with lee sin if my opponent has half health i can just sit back and leave it to him cause he'll kill them on his own.

If you are indeed going to go with these Rumble changes, can you at least make his autoattacks feel less awful? I mean, sure Rumble isn't exactly the epitome of healthy gameplay, but the reason why majority of Rumble players prefer to just spam Q from range is because trying to actually make use of Rumble autoattacks nowadays is a suicide (compare Rumble's autoattacks to {{champion:157}}, {{champion:164}}, {{champion:58}} or {{champion:105}}) . 

In a world where every single champion in the top lane has really good trading ability and both miles better autoattack animations on top of having really responsive animation cancels, if you cut down Rumble's Q damage he'll just get piledrived by any top laner. I'm not taking into consideration just the Q nerf here, I mean, given that Rumble has already been immensly weakened by all the changes, I mean, Season 6 and latest changes still left a ton of scars on Rumble ({{item:3156}} completely shuts down Rumble no matter how ahead he is, Rumble doesn't benefit from Keystones as much as other champions, {{item:3107}} and {{item:3190}} basically make you question why the hell did you pick Rumble if a ~2400 gold item migitates your entire ultimate).

And now with the mid season update, we'll have much more ways to not let Rumble player have any satisfaction of playing Rumble (Adaptive Helm comes to mind most notably), on top of tanks getting more popualrity and from what we could have seen, majority of these tanks will still indeed have a really significant damage. By nerfing Rumble's most important damage source and shifting it to the most unreliable and the worst feeling to use part of his kit, what exactly do you want to accomplish? It should be pretty obvious that due to Rumble autoattacks just feeling outright ***SHIT***. The wind-ups are way too long, the attack command seems unresponsive, when the animation finally finishes it doesn't even feel like Rumble even completed it in the first place, let alone did anything meaningful, even ***with*** the Overheat bonus. 

So with all these unfavorable odds against Rumble, please, if you are going to go this direction, I believe it's finally time Rumble autoattack animation stop being so awful.

We're planning on looking at Rumble's AAs at some point. In terms of timing they're pretty reasonable, the way the animation's done makes them much harder than they should be to read though. That makes em feel awkward/clunky.

As with any champion we'll assess where Rumble stands power wise once mid season's out.

Just please don't go on him too harsh just yet, I'm really concerned about how Adaptive Helm and the tank changes affect Rumble and I'd be more than happy to not go back to Rumble from the period of patches 5.16-6.7

Meddler about the Gargoyle Stoneplate case with true damage and HP scaling abilities, why not just make it so it gives a shield instead of hp, as it would solve both.

We could do a shield equal to current health and I wouldn't rule out the possibility we decide we should at some point. There are some things about the HP increase though that we like (counter through % hp effects, different impacts on different champs with HP scaling that isn't on true damage, lack of interaction with healing/shielding increases etc).

I get that true damage is not meant to be reduced by anything, but why can't you make stoneplate reduce it, given it has such a unique active already?  I really like how it affects max health (and things scaling of of it) and I don't want to hear that Cho's ult will be the only reason that the item gets gutted.  I've been looking at interesting builds all week for champs that could make balanced use of the item.

W= Base damage increased late game. I dont think this helps at all. Rakan is squishy and a support, we dont usually build damage and +20 damage late game doesnt do anything. If it was moved to early increase base damage maybe.

Something else you can consider. lower the base shield, revert the W damage back to how it is on live and instead give the W a new effect. Damage reduction just test it out. When Grand Entrance is used Rakan gains um [[#]] damage reduction for 2 seconds. In team fight i get popped so easy when i W in and ult...the damage reduction can help him be less squishy when he dives in. I hope my idea is considered or listened to at least. Rakan is squishy and increase damage doesnt solve his issue. Giving some damage reduction or even bonus armor and magic resist in his W or Ult for 2-3 sec can really help him out.
